Dec 16, 2018( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Castleark Management LLC 
lifted its position in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 100.0% during the 3rd quarter, according to the 
company in its most recent Form 13F filing with the SEC. The firm owned 20,420 shares of the transportation 
company's stock after purchasing an additional 10,210 shares during the quarter. Castleark Management LLC's 
holdings in Ryanair were worth $1,961,000 at the end of the most recent quarter. 
Other institutional investors have also recently added to or reduced their stakes in the company. Panagora Asset 
Management Inc. increased its stake in Ryanair by 1.9% in the third quarter. Panagora Asset Management Inc. now 
owns 35,328 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $3,393,000 after acquiring an additional 670 
shares during the last quarter. Voya Investment Management LLC increased its stake in Ryanair by 35.2% in the 
second quarter. Voya Investment Management LLC now owns 2,975 shares of the transportation company's stock 
valued at $340,000 after acquiring an additional 775 shares during the last quarter. Freestone Capital Holdings LLC 
increased its stake in Ryanair by 17.2% in the third quarter. Freestone Capital Holdings LLC now owns 5,355 
shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $514,000 after acquiring an additional 785 shares during the 
last quarter. First Republic Investment Management Inc. increased its stake in Ryanair by 8.1% in the third quarter. 
First Republic Investment Management Inc. now owns 13,089 shares of the transportation company's stock valued 
at $1,257,000 after acquiring an additional 978 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Comerica Bank increased its 
stake in Ryanair by 6.7% in the third quarter. Comerica Bank now owns 16,139 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $1,343,000 after acquiring an additional 1,008 shares during the last quarter. 43.58% of 
the stock is currently owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors. NASDAQ RYAAY[1] opened at $72.60 
on Friday. The company has a quick ratio of 1.25, a current ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62. Ryanair 
Holdings plc has a 12-month low of $72.17 and a 12-month high of $127.61. The stock has a market cap of $17.23 
billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 10.72 and a beta of 0.76. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly 
earnings results on Monday, October 22nd. The transportation company reported $4.42 earnings per share (EPS) 
for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate of $4.62 by ($0.20). Ryanair had a net margin of 17.13% and a 
return on equity of 27.63%. The business had revenue of $3.21 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' 
expectations of $3.22 billion. Sell-side analysts predict that Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.7 earnings per share for 
the current fiscal year. A number of research analysts recently commented on RYAAY shares. BidaskClub cut 
Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a research note on Thursday, September 13th. ValuEngine[2] 
raised Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Monday, September 17th. TheStreet cut 
Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a research note on Thursday, November 15th. Macquarie started 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Shares Bought by Castleark Management LLC
coverage on Ryanair in a research note on Tuesday, November 27th. They issued an "underperform" rating on the 
stock. Finally, Zacks Investment Research[3] raised Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "buy" rating and set a 
$83.00 target price on the stock in a research note on Tuesday, December 11th. Two investment analysts have 
rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have assigned a hold rating and three have issued a buy rating to the stock. 
The stock has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus price target of $83.00.  About RyanairRyanair 
Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United 
Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its

Etihad facing claims of up to (EURO)2bn over Air Berlin collapse Airlines
Etihad facing claims of up to (EURO)2bn over Air Berlin collapse; Airlines
Financial Times (London, England)
December 15, 2018 Saturday
Edition 1, European Edition
Copyright 2018 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: FEATURES; Pg. 8
Length: 333 words
Byline: TOBIAS BUCK
Body
Etihad is being sued for up to (EURO)2bn over its role in the bankruptcy of Air Berlin, a court in the German capital 
has said.
The Abu Dhabi-based airline was the main shareholder in Air Berlin, which declared insolvency in August 2017.
Air Berlin ran out of funds despite receiving a "comfort letter" from Etihad four months earlier. It declared that the 
carrier would provide backing to the lossmaking German airline over the following 18 months.
Etihad's announcement that it would no longer stand by that commitment was the trigger for Air Berlin's collapse, 
which prompted political recriminations and upheaval in Germany's aviation market.
Air Berlin had racked up losses of about (EURO)2bn in the six years leading up to its insolvency. The carrier, which 
struggled to compete with low-cost rivals such as Ryanair, had (EURO)1.2bn in net debt at the time.
In an attempt to recoup losses suffered by more than 1m claimants, Air Berlin's insolvency administrator is taking 
legal aim at Etihad.
According to a statement from the Berlin district court yesterday, the administrator "is of the opinion that [Etihad] 
gave a binding commitment. Because it violated that commitment, it should settle all the justified claims of 
creditors".
Etihad facing claims of up to (EURO)2bn over Air Berlin collapse Airlines
The administrator believes at least three separate claims worth (EURO)500m are justified. But given the large 
number of additional claimants, the court has provisionally estimated the overall value of the claims to be "up to 
(EURO)2bn".
Etihad has until the end of January to respond to the claims. The final decision over whether or not the claims are 
justified will be taken by the Berlin court. The collapse of Air Berlin was the largest aviation bankruptcy in German 
corporate history. It came at the height of the summer holiday season, sparking fears that hundreds of thousands of 
tourists could be left stranded.
The German government stepped in with a (EURO)150m bridge loan to keep the airline flying and win more time to 
find a buyer for the company's assets.
Load-Date: December 14, 2018
End of Document

Etihad facing claims of up to (EURO)2bn over Air Berlin collapse Airlines
Etihad facing claims of up to (EURO)2bn over Air Berlin collapse; Airlines
Financial Times (London, England)
December 15, 2018 Saturday
Edition 1, USA Edition
Copyright 2018 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: FEATURES; Pg. 8
Length: 333 words
Byline: TOBIAS BUCK
Body
Etihad is being sued for up to (EURO)2bn over its role in the bankruptcy of Air Berlin, a court in the German capital 
has said.
The Abu Dhabi-based airline was the main shareholder in Air Berlin, which declared insolvency in August 2017.
Air Berlin ran out of funds despite receiving a "comfort letter" from Etihad four months earlier. It declared that the 
carrier would provide backing to the lossmaking German airline over the following 18 months.
Etihad's announcement that it would no longer stand by that commitment was the trigger for Air Berlin's collapse, 
which prompted political recriminations and upheaval in Germany's aviation market.
Air Berlin had racked up losses of about (EURO)2bn in the six years leading up to its insolvency. The carrier, which 
struggled to compete with low-cost rivals such as Ryanair, had (EURO)1.2bn in net debt at the time.
In an attempt to recoup losses suffered by more than 1m claimants, Air Berlin's insolvency administrator is taking 
legal aim at Etihad.
According to a statement from the Berlin district court yesterday, the administrator "is of the opinion that [Etihad] 
gave a binding commitment. Because it violated that commitment, it should settle all the justified claims of 
creditors".
Etihad facing claims of up to (EURO)2bn over Air Berlin collapse Airlines
The administrator believes at least three separate claims worth (EURO)500m are justified. But given the large 
number of additional claimants, the court has provisionally estimated the overall value of the claims to be "up to 
(EURO)2bn".
Etihad has until the end of January to respond to the claims. The final decision over whether or not the claims are 
justified will be taken by the Berlin court. The collapse of Air Berlin was the largest aviation bankruptcy in German 
corporate history. It came at the height of the summer holiday season, sparking fears that hundreds of thousands of 
tourists could be left stranded.
The German government stepped in with a (EURO)150m bridge loan to keep the airline flying and win more time to 
find a buyer for the company's assets.
Load-Date: December 14, 2018
End of Document
Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Shares Bought by Bamco Inc. NY
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Shares Bought by Bamco Inc. NY
DailyPolitical
December 15, 2018 Saturday 10:07 AM EST
Copyright 2018 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 723 words
Body
Dec 15, 2018( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Bamco Inc. NY grew its stake in 
shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 33.2% during the 3rd quarter, according to its most recent 
13F filing with the SEC. The institutional investor owned 33,725 shares of the transportation company's stock after 
purchasing an additional 8,400 shares during the period. 
Bamco Inc. NY's holdings in Ryanair were worth $3,239,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period. Other 
hedge funds and other institutional investors also recently modified their holdings of the company. Raymond James 
Trust N.A. purchased a new stake in shares of Ryanair during the 3rd quarter worth $251,000. Victory Capital 
Management Inc. purchased a new stake in shares of Ryanair during the 3rd quarter worth $278,000. Voya 
Investment Management LLC boosted its position in shares of Ryanair by 35.2% during the 2nd quarter. Voya 
Investment Management LLC now owns 2,975 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $340,000 after 
purchasing an additional 775 shares in the last quarter. Jane Street Group LLC purchased a new stake in shares of 
Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth $371,000. Finally, Lucia Wealth Services LLC purchased a new stake in 
shares of Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth $408,000. Institutional investors own 43.58% of the company's 
stock. RYAAY has been the topic of several recent research reports. BidaskClub lowered shares of Ryanair from a 
"sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a research report on Thursday, September 13th. ValuEngine[1] upgraded 
shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a research report on Tuesday, October 16th. 
TheStreet lowered shares of Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a research report on Thursday, November 
15th. Macquarie initiated coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Tuesday, November 27th. They 
issued an "underperform" rating on the stock. Finally, Zacks Investment Research[2] upgraded shares of Ryanair 
from a "strong sell" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $83.00 price objective on the stock in a research report on 
Tuesday. Two equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have given a hold rating and 
three have assigned a buy rating to the company's stock. The stock has an average rating of "Hold" and an average 
price target of $83.00.Ryanair stock[3] opened at $72.60 on Friday. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52 week low of 
$72.17 and a 52 week high of $127.61. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62, a quick ratio of 1.25 and a 
current ratio of 1.25. The stock has a market capitalization of $17.39 billion, a P/E ratio of 10.30 and a beta of 0.76. 
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its earnings results on Monday, October 22nd. The transportation 
company reported $4.42 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Zacks' consensus estimate of $4.62 
by ($0.20). The firm had revenue of $3.21 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $3.22 
billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 17.13% and a return on equity of 27.63%. Analysts forecast that Ryanair 
Holdings plc will post 5.7 EPS for the current fiscal year.  Ryanair ProfileRyanair Holdings plc, together with its 
subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Shares Bought by Bamco Inc. NY
countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled 
services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing 
accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.Read More: Earnings Per

Ryanair (RYAAY) Stock Rating Upgraded by Zacks Investment Research
Ryanair (RYAAY) Stock Rating Upgraded by Zacks Investment Research
DailyPolitical
December 13, 2018 Thursday 12:06 PM EST
Copyright 2018 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 931 words
Body
Dec 13, 2018( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) was 
upgraded by Zacks Investment Research[1] from a "strong sell" rating to a "buy" rating in a research report issued 
on Tuesday. The brokerage currently has a $83.00 price objective on the transportation company's stock. Zacks 
Investment Research[2]'s target price indicates a potential upside of 11.80% from the stock's current price. 
According to Zacks, "Ryanair is being aided by strong demand for air travel, especially due to low air fares. Notably, 
traffic in November rose 11% year over year. We are also impressed by Ryanair's efforts to reward shareholders in 
the form of share buybacks. In tune with this, the carrier returned more than €540m to shareholders in the first six 
months of fiscal 2019. The positive sentiment surrounding the stock is evident from the Zacks Consensus Estimate 
for third-quarter fiscal 2019 earnings being revised upward more than 100% in the last 60 days. We remain positive 
on the collective deals signed by the company with German Pilot union. On the flip side, continued labor unrest, 
high costs and other headwinds are expected to hurt Ryanair's results in third quarter. The stock has shed more 
than 28% of its value so far in the year mainly due to the labor unrest."RYAAY has been the topic of several other 
research reports. ValuEngine[3] upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on 
Monday, September 17th. UBS Group reaffirmed a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research report on 
Wednesday, August 15th. BidaskClub downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a 
research report on Tuesday. TheStreet downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a 
research report on Thursday, November 15th. Finally, Royal Bank of Canada reaffirmed a "buy" rating on shares of 
Ryanair in a research report on Thursday, August 16th. Two equities research analysts have rated the stock with a 
sell rating, seven have assigned a hold rating and three have given a buy rating to the company. The company 
currently has an average rating of "Hold" and an average target price of $83.00.Shares of RYAAY stock[4] opened 
at $74.24 on Tuesday. The stock has a market cap of $17.70 billion, a PE ratio of 10.53 and a beta of 0.76. Ryanair 
has a 1-year low of $73.41 and a 1-year high of $127.61. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62, a quick 
ratio of 1.25 and a current ratio of 1.25. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly earnings results on 
Monday, October 22nd. The transportation company reported $4.42 EPS for the quarter, missing the Thomson 
Reuters' consensus estimate of $4.62 by ($0.20). Ryanair had a net margin of 17.13% and a return on equity of 
27.63%. The business had revenue of $3.21 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $3.22 
billion. Analysts forecast that Ryanair will post 5.7 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. A number of large 
investors have recently modified their holdings of RYAAY. Marshall Wace LLP bought a new stake in Ryanair in the 
third quarter valued at $1,638,000. Advisors Asset Management Inc. lifted its stake in Ryanair by 10.9% in the third 
quarter. Advisors Asset Management Inc. now owns 8,440 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$811,000 after buying an additional 832 shares during the last quarter. Castleark Management LLC lifted its stake 
Ryanair (RYAAY) Stock Rating Upgraded by Zacks Investment Research
in Ryanair by 100.0% in the third quarter. Castleark Management LLC now owns 20,420 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $1,961,000 after buying an additional 10,210 shares during the last 
quarter. Deutsche Bank AG lifted its stake in Ryanair by 1,799.1% in the third quarter. Deutsche Bank AG now 
owns 142,372 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $13,671,000 after buying an additional 
134,875 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Capital International Sarl lifted its stake in Ryanair by 2.6% in the 
third quarter. Capital International Sarl now owns 79,950 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$7,678,000 after buying an additional 2,000 shares during the last quarter. 43.58% of the stock is owned by 
institutional investors. About RyanairRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-
passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also 
involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related 
services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car

Jefferies Group LLC Has $1.39 Million Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
Jefferies Group LLC Has $1.39 Million Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(RYAAY)

Body
Dec 12, 2018( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Jefferies Group LLC lifted its 
stake in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 256.3% in the 3rd quarter, HoldingsChannel[1] reports. The 
firm owned 14,483 shares of the transportation company's stock after acquiring an additional 10,418 shares during 
the period. Jefferies Group LLC's holdings in Ryanair were worth $1,391,000 as of its most recent filing with the 
Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Other large investors also recently bought and sold shares of the 
company. 
Raymond James Trust N.A. purchased a new stake in Ryanair in the 3rd quarter worth $251,000. Victory Capital 
Management Inc. purchased a new stake in Ryanair in the 3rd quarter worth $278,000. Voya Investment 
Management LLC increased its stake in Ryanair by 35.2% in the 2nd quarter. Voya Investment Management LLC 
now owns 2,975 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $340,000 after buying an additional 775 shares 
in the last quarter. Jane Street Group LLC purchased a new stake in Ryanair in the 2nd quarter worth $371,000. 
Finally, Lucia Wealth Services LLC purchased a new stake in Ryanair in the 2nd quarter worth $408,000. Hedge 
funds and other institutional investors own 43.58% of the company's stock. A number of equities research analysts 
have issued reports on the company. Zacks Investment Research[2] upgraded Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to 
a "buy" rating and set a $83.00 price target for the company in a research note on Tuesday. BidaskClub lowered 
Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Tuesday. Macquarie assumed coverage on 
Ryanair in a research note on Tuesday, November 27th. They issued an "underperform" rating for the company. 
TheStreet lowered Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a research note on Thursday, November 15th. 
Finally, ValuEngine[3] upgraded Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a research report on 
Tuesday, October 16th. Two research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have given a hold 
rating and three have given a buy rating to the company's stock. The company currently has an average rating of 
"Hold" and a consensus price target of $83.00.Shares of Ryanair stock[4] opened at $74.00 on Wednesday. The 
stock has a market cap of $17.70 billion, a PE ratio of 10.50 and a beta of 0.76. The company has a quick ratio of 
1.25, a current ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62. Ryanair Holdings plc has a twelve month low of 
$73.41 and a twelve month high of $127.61. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings data on 
Monday, October 22nd. The transportation company reported $4.42 earnings per share for the quarter, missing the 
Zacks' consensus estimate of $4.62 by ($0.20). The firm had revenue of $3.21 billion for the quarter, compared to 
analysts' expectations of $3.22 billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 17.13% and a return on equity of 27.63%. 
Analysts anticipate that Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.7 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  Ryanair

Ryanair ( RYAAY ) Downgraded by BidaskClub
Ryanair (RYAAY) Downgraded by BidaskClub
Transcript Daily
December 12, 2018 Wednesday 5:05 PM EST
Copyright 2018 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 697 words
Body
Dec 
12, 
2018( 
Transcript 
Daily: 
https://transcriptdaily.com 
Delivered 
by 
Newstex) 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
     
https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.jpgBidaskClub[1] downgraded shares of Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research note issued to investors on Tuesday 
morning.RYAAY has been the subject of a number of other research reports. ValuEngine[2] upgraded Ryanair from 
a sell rating to a hold rating in a research report on Monday, September 17th. 
UBS Group reiterated a buy rating on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Wednesday, August 15th. 
TheStreet downgraded Ryanair from a b- rating to a c+ rating in a research report on Thursday, November 15th. 
Royal Bank of Canada reiterated a buy rating on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Thursday, August 16th. 
Finally, Macquarie began coverage on Ryanair in a research report on Tuesday, November 27th. They issued an 
underperform rating for the company. Two analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have issued a hold 
rating and three have given a buy rating to the stock. Ryanair presently has an average rating of Hold and an 
average target price of $83.00.RYAAY[3] opened at $74.00 on Tuesday. The company has a current ratio of 1.25, a 
quick ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62. Ryanair has a 12-month low of $73.41 and a 12-month high of 
$127.61. The company has a market capitalization of $17.70 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 10.50 and a beta of 
0.76. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, October 22nd. The 
transportation company reported $4.42 EPS for the quarter, missing the Zacks' consensus estimate of $4.62 by 
($0.20). Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. The firm had revenue of $3.21 
billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $3.22 billion. Research analysts expect that 
Ryanair will post 5.7 EPS for the current fiscal year. Institutional investors have recently bought and sold shares of 
the stock. Castleark Management LLC lifted its position in shares of Ryanair by 305.2% during the 2nd quarter. 
Castleark Management LLC now owns 10,210 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $1,166,000 after 
buying an additional 7,690 shares during the period. Thornburg Investment Management Inc. raised its position in 
Ryanair by 4.4% in the 3rd quarter. Thornburg Investment Management Inc. now owns 1,889,740 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $181,491,000 after purchasing an additional 79,755 shares during the last 
quarter. WCM Investment Management CA raised its position in Ryanair by 7.6% in the 3rd quarter. WCM 
Investment Management CA now owns 4,161,465 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$399,666,000 after purchasing an additional 295,462 shares during the last quarter. Mitsubishi UFJ Kokusai Asset 
Management Co. Ltd. raised its position in Ryanair by 1,804.1% in the 2nd quarter. Mitsubishi UFJ Kokusai Asset 
Management Co. Ltd. now owns 12,643 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $1,444,000 after 
purchasing an additional 11,979 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Lucia Wealth Services LLC bought a new 
position in Ryanair in the 2nd quarter valued at $408,000. Institutional investors and hedge funds own 43.58% of

European ADRs Move Higher in Tuesday Trading
European ADRs Move Higher in Tuesday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
December 11, 2018 Tuesday 10:32 AM EST
Copyright 2018 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 229 words
Body
 American depositary receipts of European stocks were trading 1% higher at 121.99 on the Bank of New York 
Mellon Europe ADR Index on Tuesday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by pharmaceutical company Oasmia Pharmaceutical (OASM) and 
computer hardware company Logitech (LOGI), which climbed 13.8% and 4% respectively. They were followed by 
telecommunications operator Telecom Italia (TI) and biopharmaceutical firm DBV Technologies (DBVT), which rose 
2.7% each.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by semiconductor company Sequans Communications (SQNS) and 
internet browser company Opera (OPRA), which lost 6.4% and 2.2% respectively. They were followed by biotech 
firm MorphoSys (MOR) and 3D printer company voxeljet (VJET), which were down 1.6% and 1.4%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by pharmaceutical company Avadel (AVDL) and communications group 
WPP (WPP), which rose 4.6% and 3.6% respectively. They were followed by mining company Rio Tinto (RIO) and 
airline operator Ryanair (RYAAY), which were up 2.3% and 2.1%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by biopharmaceutical companies Midatech Pharma (MTP), which 
tumbled 12.2%, and Akari Therapeutics (AKTX), which lost 1.9%. Gene therapy company Nightstar (NITE) and 
Lloyds Banking Group (LYG), dropped 1.2%, and 1.1% respectively. 
Price: 3.54, Change: +0.43, Percent Change: +13.83
Load-Date: December 12, 2018
End of Document
Oil prices weigh on profitability
Oil prices weigh on profitability
Flight International
December 11, 2018
Copyright 2018 Reed Business Information Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: FEATURES
Length: 427 words
Byline: XXX XXX
Body
In a year of geopolitical drama, airlines – globe-trotting national champions that they are – felt some heat. Early 
shots in a simmering US-China trade war hit sector confidence, while the Trump administration’s move to reapply 
the sanctions thumbscrews on Iran ended that country’s airline growth story by halting delivery of much-needed 
new aircraft.
Business plans in Europe, meanwhile, are being written in pencil, owing to relentless Brexit uncertainty, with its 
catastrophic, less-bad-but-still-bad and best-but-still-costly possible outcomes – namely, no-deal and flights are 
grounded, bad-deal and major market enters long-term relative decline, or no-Brexit and start counting the cost of 
trying to put everything back together.
But it was the all-too-familiar dynamics of oil prices that really set the 2018 aviation scene. From mid-2016 to mid-
2017, the benchmark Brent crude per-barrel dollar price held a mid-40s to mid-50s range before starting a steady 
rise to a mid-80s peak in October 2018; prices then headed back towards the $60 mark, but a long run of high fuel 
costs had already figured in a string of second-half profit warnings.
Still, for the larger airline groups, 2018 has been a relatively profitable period. Smaller carriers had a rougher ride; 
failures included Primera Air, which aimed to connect several northern European and US cities but was grounded 
before it had really begun its bid to join the emerging long-haul, low-cost transatlantic market.
Elsewhere, it was another tough year in India, where over-capacity, fierce competition, rising costs and a weak 
currency continue to weigh on airlines. Weak currencies also hit Latin America, dragging down travel demand in 
Argentina and Brazil.
In North America, United Airlines’ aggressive expansion began to pay off in what remains a profitable market for 
most carriers. Indeed, United boasted rising third-quarter profits despite the fuel cost drag. Other relatively good 
news saw a long-running and ill-humoured USA versus Gulf states dispute over open skies and alleged government 
subsidies at least nominally resolved.
Oil prices weigh on profitability
But, true to form, the year’s dramatic turn revolved around Ryanair boss Michael O’Leary. Under pressure, he 
dropped a longstanding refusal to entertain unionisation only to discover that his pilots rather enjoy speaking with a, 
well, united voice. And, no surprise, they have grievances; strike action hit schedules, fares, bookings and 
passenger confidence – and financial results. Iron grip on company loosening, it seems.
Armando Babani/EPA-EFE/REX/Shutterstock
Load-Date: December 11, 2018
End of Document

European ADRs Move Lower in Monday Trading
European ADRs Move Lower in Monday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
December 10, 2018 Monday 10:33 AM EST
Copyright 2018 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 225 words
Body
 American depository receipts of European stocks were trading 0.27% lower at 120.98 on the Bank of New York 
Mellon Europe ADR Index on Monday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by biotech companies Zealand Pharma (ZEAL) and MorphoSys (MOR), 
which climbed 7.9% and 3.7% respectively. They were followed by 3D printer maker voxeljet (VJET) and network 
infrastructure operator Nokia (NOK), which rose 2.4% and 2.2%.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by pharmaceutical firm Oasmia Pharmaceutical (OASM) and biotech 
company Forward Pharma (FWP), which fell 5.1% and 4.6% respectively. They were followed by biopharmaceutical 
company DBV Technologies (DBVT), which was off 3.3%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by IT services firm Endava (DAVA) and tobacco and consumer goods 
company British American Tobacco (BTI), which rose 2% and 1.8% respectively. They were followed by mining 
company BHP Billiton (BBL) and biopharmaceutical company Akari Therapeutics (AKTX), which were up 1% each.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by biopharmaceutical firm Verona Pharma (VRNA) and 
pharmaceutical company Avadel (AVDL), which lost 4.7% and 3.5% respectively. They were followed by Royal 
Bank of Scotland (RBS) and airline operator Ryanair (RYAAY), which were down 1.6% and 1.9%.
Price: 13.31, Change: +1.03, Percent Change: +8.39

Ryanair logo Capital International Sarl raised its holdings in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 2.6% 
during the third quarter, according to its most recent filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission. The fund 
owned 79,950 shares of the transportation company's stock after buying an additional 2,000 shares during the 
quarter. Capital International Sarl's holdings in Ryanair were worth $7,678,000 at the end of the most recent 
quarter.  
A number of other institutional investors and hedge funds have also added to or reduced their stakes in RYAAY. 
Castleark Management LLC grew its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 305.2% during the 2nd quarter. Castleark 
Management LLC now owns 10,210 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $1,166,000 after 
purchasing an additional 7,690 shares in the last quarter.  Thornburg Investment Management Inc. grew its 
holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 4.4% during the 3rd quarter. Thornburg Investment Management Inc. now owns 
1,889,740 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $181,491,000 after purchasing an additional 79,755 
shares in the last quarter.  WCM Investment Management CA grew its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 7.6% 
during the 3rd quarter. WCM Investment Management CA now owns 4,161,465 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $399,666,000 after purchasing an additional 295,462 shares in the last quarter.  Mitsubishi 
UFJ Kokusai Asset Management Co. Ltd. grew its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 1,804.1% during the 2nd 
quarter. Mitsubishi UFJ Kokusai Asset Management Co. Ltd. now owns 12,643 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $1,444,000 after purchasing an additional 11,979 shares in the last quarter.  Finally, Lucia 
Wealth Services LLC acquired a new stake in shares of  Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth approximately 
$408,000. 43.58% of the stock is currently owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors.  
Shares of Ryanair stock  opened at $75.58 on Monday. The company has a quick ratio of 1.25, a current ratio of 
1.25 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12 month low of $75.52 and a 12 month high of 
$127.61. The firm has a market cap of $17.70 billion, a P/E ratio of 10.72 and a beta of 0.76.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, October 22nd. The 
transportation company reported $4.42 EPS for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of $4.62 by 
($0.20). Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. The company had revenue of $3.21 
billion for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $3.22 billion.  As a group, equities research analysts 
anticipate that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.7 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  
RYAAY has been the topic of several recent research reports. BidaskClub lowered Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a 
"strong sell" rating in a report on Thursday, September 13th. Royal Bank of Canada  reissued a "buy" rating on 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Shares Bought by Capital International Sarl
shares of Ryanair in a report on Thursday, August 16th. ValuEngine  raised Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a 
"sell" rating in a research note on Tuesday, October 16th. TheStreet lowered Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" 
rating in a research note on Thursday, November 15th. Finally, UBS Group  reaffirmed a "buy" rating on shares of 
Ryanair in a research note on Wednesday, August 15th. Three analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six 
have given a hold rating and three have assigned  a buy rating to the company. The company  has a consensus 
rating of "Hold" and a consensus price target of $138.00.  
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair logo Capital International Inc. CA raised its stake in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 
88.0% in the third quarter, according to the company in its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange 
Commission. The fund owned 33,606 shares of the transportation company's stock after buying an additional 
15,731 shares during the period. Capital International Inc. CA's holdings in Ryanair were worth $3,228,000 as of its 
most recent SEC filing.  
A number of other institutional investors and hedge funds also recently made changes to their positions in RYAAY. 
Raymond James Trust N.A. purchased a new stake in  Ryanair during the 3rd quarter valued at $251,000.  Victory 
Capital Management Inc. purchased a new stake in  Ryanair during the 3rd quarter valued at $278,000.  Voya

Management LLC now owns 2,975 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $340,000 after buying 
an additional 775 shares during the last quarter.  Jane Street Group LLC purchased a new stake in  Ryanair during 
the 2nd quarter valued at $371,000.  Finally, Lucia Wealth Services LLC purchased a new stake in  Ryanair during 
the 2nd quarter valued at $408,000. Institutional investors and hedge funds own  43.58% of the company's stock.  
Shares of RYAAY stock  opened at $75.58 on Monday. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52-week low of $75.52 and a 
52-week high of $127.61. The company has a quick ratio of 1.25, a current ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 
0.62. The firm has a market capitalization of $17.70 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 10.72 and a beta of 0.76.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings results on Monday, October 22nd. The transportation 
company reported $4.42 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Zacks' consensus estimate of $4.62 
by ($0.20). Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. The business had revenue of 
$3.21 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $3.22 billion.  Analysts expect that  Ryanair 
Holdings plc will post 5.7 EPS for the current year.  
Several equities research analysts have recently commented on the company. Macquarie assumed coverage on 
Ryanair in a research note on Tuesday, November 27th. They issued an "underperform" rating for the company. 
BidaskClub upgraded Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on Friday, November 23rd. 
TheStreet lowered Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a research note on Thursday, November 15th. 
ValuEngine  upgraded Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a research note on Tuesday, October 
16th. Finally, Royal Bank of Canada  restated a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Thursday, 
August 16th. Three research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have given a hold rating and three 
Capital International Inc. CA Has $3.23 Million Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
have assigned  a buy rating to the company. The stock presently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus 
price target of $138.00.  
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Shares Sold by Capital World Investors
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Shares Sold by Capital World Investors
Transcript Daily
December 10, 2018 Monday 1:05 PM EST
Copyright 2018 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 702 words
Body
Dec 10, 2018( Transcript Daily: https://transcriptdaily.com Delivered by Newstex)  Capital World Investors trimmed 
its holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 8.8% in the third quarter, Holdings Channel[1] reports. 
The institutional investor owned 18,720,517 shares of the transportation company's stock after selling 1,801,449 
shares during the quarter. Capital World Investors owned about 0.08% of Ryanair worth $1,797,918,000 at the end 
of the most recent reporting period. 
Several other institutional investors have also added to or reduced their stakes in RYAAY. Raymond James Trust 
N.A. bought a new stake in Ryanair during the 3rd quarter worth about $251,000. Victory Capital Management Inc. 
acquired a new position in shares of Ryanair during the 3rd quarter worth about $278,000. Voya Investment 
Management LLC grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 35.2% during the 2nd quarter. Voya Investment 
Management LLC now owns 2,975 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $340,000 after buying an 
additional 775 shares during the period. Jane Street Group LLC acquired a new position in shares of Ryanair during 
the 2nd quarter worth about $371,000. Finally, Lucia Wealth Services LLC acquired a new position in shares of 
Ryanair in the 2nd quarter valued at approximately $408,000. 43.58% of the stock is owned by institutional 
investors and hedge funds. A number of equities analysts have weighed in on RYAAY shares. BidaskClub 
downgraded Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a research report on Thursday, September 13th. 
Royal Bank of Canada reaffirmed a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Thursday, August 
16th. ValuEngine[2] raised Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a research report on Tuesday, 
October 16th. TheStreet downgraded Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a research report on Thursday, 
November 15th. Finally, UBS Group reaffirmed a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research report on 
Wednesday, August 15th. Three equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have given a 
hold rating and three have issued a buy rating to the stock. Ryanair presently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and 
a consensus price target of $138.00.Shares of Ryanair stock[3] opened at $75.58 on Monday. Ryanair Holdings plc 
has a 12-month low of $75.52 and a 12-month high of $127.61. The company has a market cap of $17.70 billion, a 
PE ratio of 10.72 and a beta of 0.76. The company has a current ratio of 1.25, a quick ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-
equity ratio of 0.62. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, October 
22nd. The transportation company reported $4.42 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing analysts' 
consensus estimates of $4.62 by ($0.20). Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. 
The company had revenue of $3.21 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $3.22 billion. As 
a group, equities analysts expect that Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.7 earnings per share for the current fiscal 
year.  About RyanairRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline 
services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the

Ryanair ( RYAAY ) Hits New 1-Year Low at $76.11
Ryanair (RYAAY) Hits New 1-Year Low at $76.11
DailyPolitical
December 8, 2018 Saturday 2:09 AM EST
Copyright 2018 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 696 words
Body
Dec 07, 2018( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) hit a new 52-week low during mid-day trading on Friday . The stock traded as low as $76.11 
and last traded at $76.18, with a volume of 22735 shares trading hands. The stock had previously closed at 
$80.44.RYAAY has been the subject of several analyst reports. Raymond James cut Ryanair from an "outperform" 
rating to a "market perform" rating in a report on Thursday, August 9th. 
UBS Group restated a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Wednesday, August 15th. Royal Bank of 
Canada restated a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Thursday, August 16th. BidaskClub cut Ryanair 
from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a report on Thursday, September 13th. Finally, ValuEngine[1] 
upgraded Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Monday, September 17th. Three investment 
analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have given a hold rating and three have issued a buy rating to 
the company. The stock has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus price target of $138.00.The company 
has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62, a current ratio of 1.25 and a quick ratio of 1.25. The firm has a market cap of 
$18.89 billion, a PE ratio of 10.72 and a beta of 0.76. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly 
earnings results on Monday, October 22nd. The transportation company reported $4.42 EPS for the quarter, 
missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of $4.62 by ($0.20). Ryanair had a net margin of 17.13% and a 
return on equity of 27.63%. The business had revenue of $3.21 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst 
estimates of $3.22 billion. On average, analysts forecast that Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.7 EPS for the current 
year. Several institutional investors have recently made changes to their positions in the company. Capital 
International Investors lifted its stake in shares of Ryanair by 38.0% in the 3rd quarter. Capital International 
Investors now owns 6,143,716 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $590,042,000 after 
purchasing an additional 1,693,122 shares during the last quarter. WCM Investment Management CA lifted its stake 
in Ryanair by 7.6% during the 3rd quarter. WCM Investment Management CA now owns 4,161,465 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $399,666,000 after acquiring an additional 295,462 shares in the last quarter. 
Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA lifted its stake in Ryanair by 6.8% during the 3rd quarter. Massachusetts 
Financial Services Co. MA now owns 2,713,082 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $260,564,000 
after acquiring an additional 173,885 shares in the last quarter. JPMorgan Chase .... lifted its stake in Ryanair by 
17.3% during the 3rd quarter. JPMorgan Chase .... now owns 1,983,410 shares of the transportation company's 
stock worth $190,487,000 after acquiring an additional 293,233 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Thornburg 
Investment Management Inc. lifted its stake in Ryanair by 4.4% during the 3rd quarter. Thornburg Investment 
Management Inc. now owns 1,889,740 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $181,491,000 after 
acquiring an additional 79,755 shares in the last quarter. 43.58% of the stock is currently owned by institutional

Ryanair hit by enforcement action FLIGHT COMPENSATION
Ryanair hit by enforcement action; FLIGHT COMPENSATION
Financial Times (London, England)
December 8, 2018 Saturday
Edition 1, European Edition
Copyright 2018 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: MONEY;BUSINESS; Pg. 2
Length: 81 words
Body
The UK Civil Aviation Authority has launched an enforcement action against Ryanair after the low-cost airline 
refused to compensate thousands of British customers for flight disruption caused by eight days of strikes in the 
summer by pilots and cabin crew.
The company claimed these were "extraordinary circumstances", which meant compensation was not payable. But 
the CAA said this week passengers were entitled to payouts under European Commission regulations. Naomi 
Rovnick and Josh Spero
Load-Date: December 7, 2018
End of Document

European ADRs Move Higher in Friday Trading
European ADRs Move Higher in Friday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
December 7, 2018 Friday 10:53 AM EST
Copyright 2018 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 221 words
Body
 American depository receipts of European stocks were trading slightly higher at 123.23 on the Bank of New York 
Mellon Europe ADR Index on Friday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by biotech firm Zealand Pharma (ZEAL) and software company Talend 
(TLND), which climbed 6.4% and 5.6% respectively. They were followed by pharmaceutical company Oasmia 
Pharmaceutical (OASM) and oil and gas company Eni (E), which rose 3.9% and 3.4%.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by kidney dialysis company Fresenius Medical Care (FMS), which fell 
9.3%, followed by internet browser company Opera (OPRA), biotech firm ERYTECH Pharma (ERYP), and medical 
equipment company Edap (EDAP), which lost 2.2%, 1.8%, and 1.5% respectively. 
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by biopharmaceutical firm GW Pharmaceuticals (GWPH) and medical 
equipment maker Smith & Nephew (SNN), which rose 2.6% and 2.4% respectively. They were followed by 
biopharmaceutical company Akari Therapeutics (AKTX), and construction materials supplier CRH (CRH), which 
were up 2% and 1.5%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led in part by airline operator Ryanair (RYAAY), biotech firm Shire 
(SHPG), and gene therapy company Nightstar (NITE), which were off 2.8%, 2.7%, and 2.1% respectively. 
Price: 12.45, Change: +0.75, Percent Change: +6.41
Load-Date: December 8, 2018
End of Document

Renaissance Technologies LLC Trims Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
Renaissance Technologies LLC Trims Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
December 6, 2018 Thursday
Copyright 2018 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 720 words
Body
Ryanair logo Renaissance Technologies LLC trimmed its stake in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 0.4% in the third quarter, according to the company in its most recent 13F filing with the 
Securities and Exchange Commission. The firm owned 2,754,719 shares of the transportation company's stock 
after selling 11,689 shares during the period. Renaissance Technologies LLC owned about 1.18% of Ryanair worth 
$264,563,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period.  
Several other hedge funds also recently bought and sold shares of RYAAY. Castleark Management LLC increased 
its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 305.2% during the 2nd quarter. Castleark Management LLC now owns 10,210 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $1,166,000 after purchasing an additional 7,690 shares in the 
last quarter.  Thornburg Investment Management Inc. increased its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 4.4% during the 
3rd quarter. Thornburg Investment Management Inc. now owns 1,889,740 shares of the transportation company's 
stock worth $181,491,000 after purchasing an additional 79,755 shares in the last quarter.  WCM Investment 
Management CA increased its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 7.6% during the 3rd quarter. WCM Investment 
Management CA now owns 4,161,465 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $399,666,000 after 
purchasing an additional 295,462 shares in the last quarter.  Mitsubishi UFJ Kokusai Asset Management Co. Ltd. 
increased its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 1,804.1% during the 2nd quarter. Mitsubishi UFJ Kokusai Asset 
Management Co. Ltd. now owns 12,643 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $1,444,000 after 
purchasing an additional 11,979 shares in the last quarter.  Finally, Lucia Wealth Services LLC purchased a new 
position in shares of  Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth approximately $408,000. Institutional investors own  
43.58% of the company's stock.  
A number of research analysts have recently weighed in on the stock. Macquarie assumed coverage on shares of 
Ryanair in a research note on Tuesday, November 27th. They set an "underperform" rating for the company. 
BidaskClub raised shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on Friday, November 
23rd. ValuEngine  cut shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a research note on Tuesday, 
October 2nd. Raymond James cut shares of Ryanair from an "outperform" rating to a "market perform" rating in a 
research note on Thursday, August 9th. Finally, UBS Group  reaffirmed a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a 
research note on Wednesday, August 15th. Three equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, 
six have given a hold rating and three have given a buy rating to the company. Ryanair currently has a consensus 
rating of "Hold" and a consensus target price of $138.00. 
Renaissance Technologies LLC Trims Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
RYAAY stock  opened at $79.82 on Thursday. The company has a market capitalization of $18.89 billion, a price-
to-earnings ratio of 11.32 and a beta of 0.76. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62, a current ratio of 1.25 
and a quick ratio of 1.25. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of $76.92 and a one year high of $127.61.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its earnings results on Monday, October 22nd. The transportation 
company reported $4.42 EPS for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of $4.62 by 
($0.20). The firm had revenue of $3.21 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $3.22 
billion. Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%.  As a group, sell-side analysts expect 
that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.7 EPS for the current year.   
Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Shares Bought by NS Partners Ltd
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Shares Bought by NS Partners Ltd
American Banking and Market News
December 6, 2018 Thursday
Copyright 2018 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 730 words
Body
Ryanair logo NS Partners Ltd grew its stake in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 30.4% in the 
3rd quarter, according to its most recent disclosure with the SEC. The institutional investor  owned 117,476 shares 
of the transportation company's stock after acquiring an additional 27,400 shares during the period. NS Partners Ltd 
owned about 0.05% of Ryanair worth $11,282,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.  
Several other institutional investors also recently bought and sold shares of the company. WCM Investment 
Management CA increased its holdings in  Ryanair by 7.6% during the third quarter. WCM Investment Management 
CA now owns 4,161,465 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $399,666,000 after buying an 
additional 295,462 shares during the period.  JPMorgan Chase & Co. increased its holdings in  Ryanair by 17.3% 
during the third quarter. JPMorgan Chase & Co. now owns 1,983,410 shares of the transportation company's stock 
valued at $190,487,000 after buying an additional 293,233 shares during the period.  Credit Suisse AG increased 
its holdings in  Ryanair by 732.6% during the third quarter. Credit Suisse AG now owns 243,780 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $23,413,000 after buying an additional 214,500 shares during the period.  
Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA increased its holdings in  Ryanair by 6.8% during the third quarter. 
Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 2,713,082 shares of the transportation company's stock 
valued at $260,564,000 after buying an additional 173,885 shares during the period.  Finally, Bank of New York 
Mellon Corp increased its holdings in  Ryanair by 281.8% during the third quarter. Bank of New York Mellon Corp 
now owns 135,340 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $12,998,000 after buying an additional 
99,891 shares during the period. 43.58% of the stock is owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors.  
Several research firms have issued reports on RYAAY. BidaskClub lowered shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to 
a "strong sell" rating in a report on Thursday, September 13th. Royal Bank of Canada  reaffirmed a "buy" rating on 
shares of Ryanair in a report on Thursday, August 16th. ValuEngine  raised shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" 
rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Tuesday, October 16th. TheStreet lowered shares of Ryanair from a "b-" rating 
to a "c+" rating in a report on Thursday, November 15th. Finally, UBS Group  reaffirmed a "buy" rating on shares of 
Ryanair in a report on Wednesday, August 15th. Three research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six 
have issued  a hold rating and three have assigned  a buy rating to the company's stock. The stock currently has a 
consensus rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $138.00. 
Shares of RYAAY  traded up $0.51 during trading hours on Thursday, reaching $81.17. 5,083 shares of the 
company traded hands, compared to its average volume of 447,459. The firm has a market capitalization of $18.89 
billion, a PE ratio of 11.45 and a beta of 0.76. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62, a current ratio of 1.25 
and a quick ratio of 1.25. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12-month low of $76.92 and a 12-month high of $127.61.  
Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Shares Bought by NS Partners Ltd
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, October 22nd. The 
transportation company reported $4.42 earnings per share for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates 
of $4.62 by ($0.20). The company had revenue of $3.21 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations 
of $3.22 billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 17.13% and a return on equity of 27.63%.  As a group, research 
analysts anticipate that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.7 EPS for the current fiscal year.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Institutional Ownership by Quarter for Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY)

Ryanair : winging it Twitter : @FTLex
Ryanair: winging it; Twitter: @FTLex
Financial Times (London, England)
December 6, 2018 Thursday
Edition 1, European Edition
Copyright 2018 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 12
Length: 373 words
Body
Ryanair's latest controversy brings "situation normal all fouled up" to mind. The low-cost Irish airline says it owes 
passengers no compensation for strike-related flight disruption this summer because this reflected "extraordinary 
circumstances". Cue hollow laughs from customers who regard a lousy service from Ryanair as entirely predictable. 
Cue, also, enforcement action from the UK's Civil Aviation Authority.
Ryanair's vulnerabilities have been mercilessly exposed by the dispute. The bosses of Europe's legacy flag carriers 
must be enjoying every minute. The company's exemplary margins have depended on toughness towards staff and 
customers. Damaging friction with both groups have shown how weak corporate governance standards are. 
Directors allowed a combative chief executive to push both relationships too far.
Higher fuel costs have not helped, contributing to a 9 per cent drop in half-year pre-tax profits to (EURO)1.3bn. 
Average fares have fallen 3 per cent to under (EURO)46. Margins have been squeezed 4 percentage points to 25 
per cent. Shares have fallen more than those of UK rival easyJet this year.
Labour relations are, in theory, improving. The company has agreed a deal with German pilots and is in 
negotiations with others.
The difficulty is that the jokey obstreperousness of Michael O'Leary lacks restraint. Rows with unions and regulators 
will recur too.
David Bonderman has been chairman for an incredible 22 years, weathering a censure vote this autumn. The whole 
board lacks independence and needs refreshing. A clear succession plan is needed for Mr O'Leary, an admirable 
entrepreneur who has been CEO since 1994.
Ryanair : winging it Twitter : @FTLex
The fight over compensation only adds to investor frustration. The decision of the airline to quit the UK' s aviation 
dispute resolution body is peevish and ill-judged.
It is unclear how much money is at stake. Assuming 60,000 passengers fill out the paperwork and make a claim for 
the minimum (EURO)250, then the airline might have to pay out (EURO)15m. Analysts who regard that as a 
modest cost of business are deluding themselves. It is a token of a bigger problem.
Ryanair has aspired to be a friendlier airline. Without a governance shake-up, that initiative will remain permanently 
grounded.
Load-Date: December 5, 2018
End of Document

Ryanair hit by enforcement action over rejected payouts Airlines
Ryanair hit by enforcement action over rejected payouts; Airlines
Financial Times (London, England)
December 6, 2018 Thursday
Edition 1, USA Edition
Copyright 2018 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: COMPANIES AND MARKETS;NEWS; Pg. 16
Length: 359 words
Byline: NAOMI ROVNICK AND JOSH SPERO
Body
The UK Civil Aviation Authority has launched an enforcement action against Ryanair after the low-cost airline 
refused to compensate thousands of British customers for flight disruption over the summer.
Ryanair, whose passengers suffered delayed or cancelled flights because of eight days of strikes by pilots and 
cabin crew, said at the time that these were "extraordinary circumstances", which meant compensation was not 
payable.
But yesterday, the CAA said that passengers affected were entitled to payouts under the European Commission's 
regulation 261. People whose claims were rejected had been able to escalate complaints to AviationADR, a dispute 
resolution body approved by the CAA and used by many airlines. However, Ryanair has now cancelled its 
agreement with AviationADR, the CAA said. The CAA added that passengers who believed they had valid 
compensation claims for the summer disruption would now have to "await the outcome of the Civil Aviation 
Authority's enforcement action" before finding out if they will get any money back.
The CAA can ask for undertakings from businesses to make them comply with the law. It can go to court for an 
enforcement order if the business does not act or breaches undertakings.
Ryanair said: "Courts in Germany, Spain and Italy have already ruled that strikes are an 'exceptional circumstance' 
and EU261 compensation does not apply. We expect the UK CAA and courts will follow this precedent."
Ryanair hit by enforcement action over rejected payouts Airlines
However, the European Court of Justice ruled in April that wildcat strikes - rather than those agreed by a trade 
union - by staff of the TUIfly airline were subject to EU261 rules since conflicts with staff were "inherent" in business 
and were not extraordinary. "That rather takes you to the conclusion that the ECJ is going to be relatively 
unsympathetic to strikes by airline employees," said Simon Phippard of law firm Bird &Bird.
In 2017, Ryanair paid (EURO)25m in EU261 costs after it cancelled 2,000 flights in September and October 
because of rostering problems. The strikes this summer involved at least 650 cancellations, suggesting a bill of 
around (EURO)8m if the CAA is successful in its enforcement. See Lex
Load-Date: December 5, 2018
End of Document

MARKETS SENSE A SOFTER BREXIT Stocks lifted by investor bets that Brussels divorce will be amicable
MARKETS SENSE A SOFTER BREXIT; Stocks lifted by investor bets that 
Brussels divorce will be amicable
City A.M.
December 6, 2018 Thursday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2018 City A.M. All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 1
Length: 347 words
Byline: SEBASTIAN MCCARTHY
Body
BRITAIN'S largest housebuilders, banks and airline groups enjoyed a share-price bounce yesterday as investors 
took the view that a nodeal Brexit appears less likely. Property heavyweights such as Berkeley Group, Persimmon 
and Redrow were among the top 10 FTSE risers yesterday after a frantic 24 hours of political tussling in 
Westminster fuelled the possibility of a "softer" Brexit.
Blue-chip constituents Persimmon and Berkeley Group saw share prices close up seven and six per cent 
respectively, while FTSE 250 firm Redrow also climbed six per cent.
Meanwhile, Royal Bank of Scotland and Lloyds Banking Group saw shares rise by 2.4 per cent and 1.43 per cent 
respectively while airline firms EasyJet , Ryanair and British Airways owner International Airlines Group also ended 
the day higher.
This week's political developments signalled a creeping return to confidence in the City, with a research note 
published by JP Morgan forecasting a 40 per cent chance of the UK staying in the European Union.
Such an outlook from analysts comes on the back of Theresa May's three defeats in Parliament on Tuesday night, 
which prompted renewed speculation over the chances of another referendum or a pivot to membership of the 
European Economic Area.
"Events in Westminster have trumped a poor reading of economic activity in the services sector to lift the share 
prices of companies plugged into the domestic UK economy," said Laith Khalaf, a senior analyst at Hargreaves 
Lansdown. Khalaf added: "Housebuilding stocks in particular have risen in value as the market perceives greater 
parliamentary control over the Brexit process as likely to lead to a softer withdrawal from the EU.
MARKETS SENSE A SOFTER BREXIT Stocks lifted by investor bets that Brussels divorce will be amicable
Lloyds and RBS are also having a good day on the back of sunnier expectations for the UK economy". A successful 
amendment from Tory Remainer Dominic Grieve late on Tuesday means that MPs will likely be able to vote on 
what it wants the government to do if the Prime Minister fails to win a majority for her own deal, with the possibility 
that parliament could decide to take a "no deal" outcome off of the table.

Ryanair hit by watchdog's drive on strike redress Airlines ; CAA starts enforcement action after carrier rejects 
passenger compensation
Ryanair hit by watchdog's drive on strike redress; Airlines ; CAA starts 
enforcement action after carrier rejects passenger compensation
Financial Times (London, England)
December 6, 2018 Thursday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2018 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: COMPANIES AND MARKETS;FEATURES; Pg. 20
Length: 475 words
Byline: NAOMI ROVNICK ;JOSH SPERO
Body
The Civil Aviation Authority has launched an enforcement action against Ryanair after the low-cost airline refused to 
compensate thousands of British customers for flight disruption over the summer.
Ryanair, whose passengers suffered delayed or cancelled flights because of eight days of strikes by pilots and 
cabin crew, said at the time that these were "extraordinary circumstances", which meant compensation was not 
payable.
But yesterday, the CAA said that passengers affected were entitled to payouts under the European Commission's 
regulation 261. People whose compensation claims were rejected had been able to escalate their complaints to 
AviationADR, a dispute resolution body approved by the CAA and used by many major airlines. However, Ryanair 
has now cancelled its agreement with AviationADR, the CAA said.
The CAA added that passengers who believed they had valid compensation claims for the summer disruption would 
now have to "await the outcome of the Civil Aviation Authority's enforcement action" before finding out if they would 
get any money back.
The CAA can ask for undertakings from businesses to make them comply with the law. It can go to court for an 
enforcement order if the business does not act, or breaches undertakings.
Ryanair hit by watchdog's drive on strike redress Airlines ; CAA starts enforcement action after carrier rejects 
passenger compensation
Ryanair said: "Courts in Germany, Spain and Italy have already ruled that strikes are an 'exceptional circumstance' 
and EU261 compensation does not apply. We expect the UK CAA and courts will follow this precedent."
However, the European Court of Justice ruled in April that wildcat strikes - rather than those agreed by a union - by 
staff of the TUIfly airline were subject to EU261 rules since conflicts with staff were "inherent" in an airline's 
business and were not extraordinary.
"That rather takes you to the conclusion that the ECJ is going to be relatively unsympathetic to strikes by airline 
employees," said Simon Phippard of law firm Bird &Bird.
In 2017, Ryanair paid (EURO)25m in EU261 costs after it cancelled 2,000 flights in September and October 
because of rostering problems. The strikes this summer involved at least 650 cancellations, suggesting a bill of 
around (EURO)8m if the CAA is successful in its enforcement. Ryanair noted in its most recent annual report that 
"passengers have a higher propensity to claim [under EU261] than in prior years".
The carrier has been engaged in negotiations with its unions since agreeing to recognise them in late 2017 after a 
rostering failure and staff shortage led to thousands of cancellations.
It has been making gradual progress in resolving its industrial relations problems which led to the summer strikes. 
At the end of November, it signed a framework agreement with its German pilots ahead of a collective labour 
agreement early next year, and it has reached collective labour agreements with cabin crew in Germany, Belgium 
and Italy. See Lex
Load-Date: December 5, 2018
End of Document

closest to five being the most favorable.

TOP NEWS SUMMARY: UK Government To Publish Full Brexit Legal Advice

Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
December 5, 2018 Wednesday 6:50 AM EST
Copyright 2018 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 753 words
Body
 The following is a summary of top news stories Wednesday.----------COMPANIES----------Japan's Takeda 
Pharmaceutical announced its shareholders approved resolutions related to the proposed acquisition of Irish 
drugmaker Shire. Takeda said its proposal to delegate to the Takeda board the decision regarding the offering 
terms for the issuance of the new Takeda shares required to implement the deal was approved as originally 
proposed by at least 88% of the votes exercised in respect of this proposal. Takeda has now satisfied the 
shareholder approval condition required to implement the deal. The acquisition remains subject to approval by Shire 
shareholders at meetings expected to be held later Wednesday, and to the sanctioning of the Shire scheme of 
arrangement by the Jersey Court at a hearing expected to be held on January 3. It is expected that completion of 
the acquisition will take place on January 8. The last day of dealings for Shire shares on the London Stock 
Exchange will be Friday, January 4. Shire will be removed from the FTSE 100 index on Monday, January 7, 
according to index provider FTSE Russell.----------BT Group will strip Huawei Technologies Co's equipment from its 
core 4G network as government pressure to boycott the Chinese firm mounts, the Financial Times reported. 
BT's decision will bring its mobile network in line with an internal policy designed to keep the Chinese firm out of its 
telecoms infrastructure, the FT said. BT will, within two years, remove Huawei's technology from unit EE's network, 
which relied on the Chinese firm's kit to build its 3G and 4G network. World governments have started to become 
wary of Huawei, with the US, Australia and New Zealand blocking the use of the Chinese company's 5G equipment 
on "security grounds", as they are afraid of possible interference by China, the newspaper noted.----------The UK 
Civil Aviation Authority said it started enforcement action against Ryanair Holdings, after the budget airline refused 
to compensate customers affected by a long streak of summer strikes. The regulator said passengers who have 
made claims for compensation directly to the airline have seen them be rejected, as Ryanair decided under 
European Commission Regulation 261/2004 "financial compensation is not payable" with regards to its staff's 
industrial action. The CAA said passengers have been able to escalate their complaints to AviationADR, a body in 
charge of providing resolutions for complaints. However, the CAA said that Ryanair has now terminated its 
agreement with AviationADR, resulting in the regulator deciding to take action. Ryanair responded in a statement: 
"Courts in Germany, Spain and Italy have already ruled that strikes are an "extraordinary circumstance" and EU261 
compensation does not apply. We expect the UK CAA and Courts will follow this precedent."----------Stagecoach 
Group said it swung to a loss in the first half of its current financial year, but adjusted earnings were ahead of 
TOP NEWS SUMMARY: UK Government To Publish Full Brexit Legal Advice
expectations. The transport operator swung to a pretax loss of GBP22.6 million in the six months to October 27 
from GBP96.7 million profit reported for the same period a year earlier. Adjusted pretax profit declined by 10% to 
GBP87.0 million from GBP96.7 million year-on-year. The result was hurt by lower revenue, which fell by a third to 
GBP1.23 billion from GBP1.79 billion year-on-year due to the expiry of South West Trains franchise in August last 
year and the Virgin Trains East Coast franchise in June. Revenue in the UK Rail division was down 63% to 
GBP335.1 million from GBP899.2 million year-on-year. Like-for-like revenue, which includes East Midlands Trains 
and Sheffield Supertram businesses, rose by 0.4% to GBP202.1 million from GBP201.3 million. Stagecoach 
maintained its interim payout at 3.8 pence a share. ----------MARKETS----------London shares were sharply lower 
amid trade concerns and fears over a possible slowdown in the US economy after the US Treasury curve inverted 
for the first time in more than a decade. The pound was flat against the dollar after disappointing UK services PMI 
data. Oil prices rose ahead of the OPEC meeting on Thursday. Financial markets in the US are closed for the 
funeral of former president George HW Bush. ----------FTSE 100: down 1.0% at 6,951.24FTSE 250: down 0.2% at

LONDON BRIEFING: UK Regulator Takes Enforcement Action Against Ryanair
LONDON BRIEFING: UK Regulator Takes Enforcement Action Against 
Ryanair
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
December 5, 2018 Wednesday 3:12 AM EST
Copyright 2018 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 367 words
Body
 The UK Civil Aviation Authority on Wednesday said it started enforcement action against Ryanair Holdings, after 
the budget airline refused to compensate customers affected by a long streak of summer strikes.
The regulator said that passengers who have made claims for compensation directly to the airline have seen them 
be rejected, as Ryanair decided that under European Commission Regulation 261/2004 "financial compensation is 
not payable" with regards to its staff's industrial action.
The CAA said that passengers have been able to escalate their complaints to AviationADR, a body in charge of 
providing resolutions for complaints. However, the CAA said that Ryanair has now terminated its agreement with 
AviationADR, resulting in the regulator deciding to take action.
Reiterating its view at the time of the strikes, the CAA said that in its opinion, "the strikes were not "extraordinary 
circumstances" and were not exempt, meaning consumers should be compensated in accordance with Regulation 
EC261/2004".
Ryanair shares were up 0.1% in early London trade.
Here is what you need to know at the market open:----------MARKETS----------FTSE 100: down 1.2% at 6,938.65-----

25,027.07S&P 500: closed down 3.2% at 2,700.06----------GBP: down at USD1.2692 (USD1.2732)EUR: down at 
USD1.1329 (USD1.1352)

(changes since previous London equities close)----------ECONOMICS AND GENERAL----------Wednesday's Key 
Economic Events still to come
